column4: Hi there. Evolution's default notifications are really, really lame... e.g, "1 new message in Inbox." I'd like it to say the sender and subject of new messages. Can I get it to do this?
well.. there is small task tray app called.. mail-notification or similar that does that.. not sure if you can make it check your evolution mailbox though
try the logs.. syslog, dmesg, kern.log
Nothing concerning the crash in any of those logs.
then I guess it's back to running the app from a terminal.. I don't know of any other way

That is unacceptable. I will not run every program that I would ever want to run from a terminal. I was running XChat a couple minutes ago, and it randomly crashed, seemingly for no reason. There must be some way to notify me why a program crashes.
oh.. I'm so sorry.. I will immediately go fix it.. our custo... wait a minute.. I didn't create the system.. yea.. that's right.. I'm just a user.. go away
I'm not complaining at you, I'm letting off steam. Cool it.
Though I do apologize, I guess it did seem that way.
apology accepted.. I still don't know of any other way though.. if there is a segmentation fault or something like that it usually ends up in the syslog..
Looks like I turned off my loggers. :x I'll turn them back on, and check next time an app crashes. Still, it'd be nice if a notification popped up or something. Maybe I'll stop by brainstorm.
I wouldn't start worrying until it's been an hour or so
it depends on what you want to torture it with.. but running abiword, gnumeric and xfce might just work nicely
I run xubuntu on my mini-itx board.. those are kind of slow (but still modern so it might not be comparable)
